column4: Nope, that's a different error :) This time you don't have GST installed - line 102 in your pastie. It wants the packages listed in lines 109 through 114. To get them, I'd: aptitude search <PACKAGENAME> then apt-get install <PACKAGE> until you meet all dependancies.
You don't have GTK installed. Try 'sudo apt-get install libgtk2.0-dev
same error, looks like.  I installed like you said :(
can I do step 3 on https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CompilingEasyHowTo to batch-add all dependencies?
I've not used that method. It would probably work.
it says to use auto apt, but I don't get how to work it into my source install. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AutoApt

Like I said, I havn't used it. I would search for pacakges needed and install using apt, then copy my history into a file (history | grep apt >> file.txt), then turn it into a script to run on other computers (like this one: http://pastebin.com/xNZGqKwy)
yes, I am.  banshee 2.3.1 isn't supported by ubuntu yet in the repos
You could just use the ubuntu repos to install it :) apt-get install banshee.
open a file called something.sh, then basically copy the script I linked you except change the package names. Needs to start with #!/bin/bash. Then just run 'sh something.sh' to run it.
oops. 'sudo sh something.sh' because it's got apt- in it, and you'd want to run that as admin.
I have to run, I have a class - if you've got problems I'll be around in a few hours, if nobody else here can help. Good luck.
real quick, what parts do i replace again?
